name: DevFest Bronx
description: Don't miss DevFest Bronx, the leading tech conference in the Bronx, taking place December 6, 2024 at Lehman College.  This exciting event brings together students, developers, and tech enthusiasts to explore the latest innovations in AI, web, mobile, android, iOS, and social impact.  Connect with local talent, discover new opportunities, and be a part of the growing Bronx tech community. Visit our website to learn more and register today!
author: GDG Bronx
keywords: bronx developer festival gdg google tech conference

speakers.name: Albina Krasykova
speakers.title: AI Engineer
speakers.bio: Albina is a Lehman College alumna with a CS major. She is passionate about ML and AI research, particularly in applications such as health tech, accessible education, urban systems, and NLP. Some of her experience includes CSRMP at Google, Breakthrough Tech AI @ Cornell Tech, ML Engineer @ ASAPP, Recommendation System participant in a Google Kaggle competition, Computer Vision Researcher @ Cornell Tech, Data Researcher @ MTA and SWE @ Cake AI. Fun fact, Albina has been swimming for 18 years and coaching for 3 years.

speakers.name: Allen Firstenberg
speakers.title: Google Developer Expert
speakers.bio: By day, Allen is a Senior Project Engineer at http://spiders.com/ where he’s been instrumental in creating websites and mobile apps for companies and organizations, ranging from the American Booksellers Association to the National Science Foundation. By night he creates tools, software, and tutorials to help people share their stories and improve their digital lives. You'll find him contributing to the LangChainJS open source project, as one of the two hosts of the "Two Voice Devs" podcast, and co-author of the O’Reilly book "Designing and Developing for Google Glass". He is a Google Developer Expert for Machine Learning, Google Workspace, and the Google Assistant and has been known to occasionally wear light blue shirts.

speakers.name: Atuoha Anthony
speakers.title: Mobile Software Engineer
speakers.bio: Mobile Software Engineer specializing in Flutter/Dart, Kotlin (Jetpack Compose), & Swift/SwiftUI, with a comprehensive background in web technologies. Skilled in designing, developing, and deploying software for Android, iOS, Web, and other platforms. Adept at collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to create high-quality, scalable products.

speakers.name: Roman Jaquez
speakers.title: Google Developer Expert in Flutter
speakers.bio: Roman Jaquez is a Google Developer Expert in Flutter as well as a Google Certified Cloud Architect who loves sharing his passion for Flutter with the wider developer community. He is also lead organizer at GDG Lawrence with 10+ years of experience as a software engineer. He enjoys spreading the word about best practices in the industry ranging from mobile, web and cloud.

speakers.name: Brendan Collins
speakers.title: Executive Director
speakers.bio: Brendan Collins is the Executive Director of the Tech Talent Pipeline (TTP), which is the city's tech industry partnerships team run out of the Mayor's office. TTP bridges the gap among City government, employers, and educators to support both the city’s growing tech industry and tech workforce. Before joining the Mayor's Office, Brendan ran Google's public higher education outreach and recruiting programs.

speakers.name: Christelle Scharff
speakers.title: Professor of Computer Science, Associate Dean, and Co-director of the AI Lab
speakers.bio: Dr. Christelle Scharff is a Professor of Computer Science, Associate Dean, and Co-director of the AI Lab at Pace University in NY. She has a Ph.D. in Symbolic Artificial Intelligence (Theorem Proving and Automated Deduction) from INRIA, the French National Institute for Research in Digital Science and Technology. She published more than 30 papers in artificial intelligence, mobile for social change and global software engineering. She was awarded grants from NSF, IBM, Microsoft, and Google. She taught in France, Senegal, Benin, Cambodia and Vietnam. She was a US Fulbright scholar in Senegal in 2012 and 2019.

speakers.name: Alexandra Feldhausen
speakers.title: Director of Career Development
speakers.bio: Ali Feldhausen is the Director of Career Development at All Tech is Human, where she oversees the ATIH Careers vertical. Before joining ATIH, Ali was the Director of Insights and Engagement at the NYC Mayor’s Office of Talent and Workforce Development’s Tech Talent Pipeline (TTP). While at TTP, she was responsible for overseeing the CUNY 2X Tech Initiative, maintaining partnerships across the tech ecosystem with employers and education providers, and leading the CUNY Computer Science Career Development Council, a consortium of career development specialists from across CUNY.

speakers.name: Hessvacio Hassan
speakers.title: Creative Lead
speakers.bio: Hessvacio Hassan is the creator and lead developer of the Webby-nominated VR series, Museum Multiverse, designed for HTC, Pico, and Oculus. His previous release, Don't Look Away VR, has been downloaded over 250,000 times. Hessvacio is active in New York City’s indie game community, creating and supporting local projects that span from arcade cabinet games to messenger-based games promoting Facebook's platform.

speakers.name: Joel Guerrero
speakers.title: UI/UX Designer
speakers.bio: Joel is a mid-level UI/UX Designer with six years of experience crafting digital experiences for early- and mid-stage startups. He currently works as a UI/UX Designer at the Simons Foundation, an organization dedicated to advancing the frontiers of basic science and mathematics. In his role, Joel collaborates with the web experience team to design and conduct research for various foundation initiatives, including neuroscience publications like Quanta Magazine and The Transmitter.

speakers.name: Kevin Galligan
speakers.title: Technology Partner
speakers.bio: Technology Partner at Touchlab. Kevin started with Android development before there were Android phones, and has been building native mobile applications exclusively since 2010. Kevin and Touchlab have been focused on KMP since the platform's announcement, and have contributed extensively to the ecosystem's libraries and community.

talks.title: Succeed in the age of AI
talks.description: The session would be focused on exploring strategies for thriving in the fast-paced AI world, including learning quickly, adapting, asking the right questions while adding an emphasis taking time for breaks, living your life and maintaining good health.
talks.speaker: Albina Krasykova

talks.title: Gemini: One Year Later
talks.description: One year ago, on this very stage, we got a first glimpse of Google Gemini and what it could do that no other Large Language Model could. Now, one year later, let's see how far Gemini has come - and what it means for where we, as developers, are going next.
talks.speaker: Allen Firstenberg

talks.title: Flutter for Web: Expanding Beyond Mobile
talks.description: Explore Flutter’s versatility as we expand beyond mobile to the web. Learn how to build responsive, high-performance web applications using Flutter, with insights into best practices, deployment strategies, and real-world use cases. This session is perfect for developers looking to broaden their Flutter skills into web development.
talks.speaker: Atuoha Anthony

talks.title: Beyond Chatbots:  Unlocking Gemini's  Potential through Flutter
talks.description: We'll explore how Gemini empowers developers to craft intuitive, conversational interfaces, enabling seamless interactions and effortless communication between users and your app.
talks.speaker: Roman Jaquez

talks.title: How to Navigate the NYC Tech Job Market
talks.description: I'll walk through the steps for students how to best navigate their career opportunities as a tech worker in NYC.
talks.speaker: Brendan Collins

talks.title: Unlocking the Power of Kotlin for Android Development
talks.description: This talk will provide an overview of the Kotlin programming language. It presents the full potential of Kotlin for Android development.
talks.speaker: Christelle Scharff

talks.title: Responsible Tech Careers
talks.description: During this session, students will learn more about the diverse pathways to careers in Responsible Tech.
talks.speaker: Alexandra Feldhausen

talks.title: My XR Playground
talks.description: I’ll share my journey in VR and AR development, starting with no computer science degree. By exploring my path from self-learning to creating immersive experiences, I hope to inspire others interested in VR and AR to see that a formal tech background isn’t required to make meaningful progress in this field.
talks.speaker: Hessvacio Hassan

talks.title: Designing for all - Accessibility in the modern digital age
talks.description: This session explores how accessible design supports people with disabilities, the assistive technologies they rely on, and why prioritizing it benefits everyone. Learn why practical strategies like using proper color contrast, the importance of semantic headers, and using alt text for images can create inclusive interfaces that empower all users, fostering social equity in the process. Gain insights into how designing with accessibility in mind meets diverse needs and strengthens user engagement and satisfaction.
talks.speaker: Joel Guerrero

talks.title: The Future of Android, Kotlin, and Everything
talks.description: For many mobile products today, native is not the likely choice. Some form of cross-platform is used. Kotlin Multiplatform and Compose Multiplatform removes the barrier between the two paths, and with the community's help, can be the default choice for mobile development.
talks.speaker: Kevin Galligan

agenda.title: Unlocking the Power of Kotlin for Android Development
agenda.speaker: Christelle Scharff

strings.speaker: Speaker
strings.eventContent: Great selection of speakers and content for an unforgettable experience.
strings.workshops: Bring your laptop and join us for hands-on workshops.
strings.networking: Meet our community of developers, designers, and tech enthusiasts.
